title: Coverage hub: PGL Major Stockholm
description: Catch up with everything happening at the Major through the coverage hub which includes previews, interviews, photos, and other updates from Stockholm.

title: Photos: Virtus.pro, ENCE celebrate after securing Legends Stage
description: Check out some highlight moments from the third day of the Challengers Stage at PGL Major Stockholm, where HLTV.org's photographers captured players rejoicing after they advanced to the Legends Stage.

title: Astralis - Spirit headlines final Challengers Stage matchups
description: The fifth and last round of games in the Challengers Stage of PGL Major Stockholm will feature six teams playing for progression to the top 16.

title: ropz shines as MOUZ eliminate Renegades from PGL Major Stockholm
description: Christopher "dexter" Nong saw off his former teammates to put MOUZ just one win away from the Legends Stage.

title: alex: "This feels real now, we're playing a Major, so there's more pressure"
description: We sat down with Movistar Riders IGL Alejandro "alex" Masanet to hear about his team's journey so far at the PGL Major's Challengers Stage.

title: Astralis eliminate paiN; need one more win for Legends Stage
description: A bittersweet end to the event for paiN who showed promise but failed to capitalize on their opportunities.

title: ENCE punch their ticket to the Legends Stage after defeating BIG
description: BIG have one last chance to qualify for the next stage of the Major.

title: Movistar Riders survive TYLOO to keep Major dream alive
description: Movistar Riders joined the 2-2 pool in the Major's Challenger Stage after knocking TYLOO out in overtime on the decider map.

title: hooch: "We're still a young team which doesn't understand their full power yet"
description: We caught up with Entropiq's coach, Dmitry "hooch" Bogdanov, to discuss his team's impressive run at the Major so far after their qualification for the next stage.

title: Virtus.pro triumph in close series to clinch Legends Stage berth
description: Spirit fought tooth and nail, taking the final map all the way to overtime, but Virtus.pro came out on top in the all-CIS matchup.
